intro: Hieracium myriaphorum, commonly known as the many-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, with numerous small florets arranged in a dense, flat head. Hieracium myriaphorum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and disturbed soils.
